headline: Visa’s Fintech Partnerships Meet Valuation Opportunity In Payments Expansion
summary: Visa (NYSE:V) is partnering with Amenify to embed payments and rewards into the U.S. rental housing ecosystem for residents using existing Visa cards. The company is working with Mercuryo on a global crypto off-ramping solution that uses Visa Direct to convert digital assets into fiat currency. Visa has reached an agreement with UnionPay International to expand cross-border remittance capabilities into China for transfers to UnionPay cardholders. For Visa, these moves sit at the...

headline: Visa Direct and UnionPay International Will Extend Global Money Movement Network to Billions of Cards in Chinese Mainland
summary: SAN FRANCISCO & DOHA, Qatar, February 03, 2026--At Web Summit Qatar, Visa (NYSE:V) and UnionPay International (UPI) announced an agreement to enable cross-border money movement into Chinese Mainland through Visa Direct. Once fully rolled out, clients will be able to send cross-border remittances and business-to-consumer payouts to more than 95 percent of UnionPay International debit cardholders in Chinese Mainland, through a single connection.

raw.headline: Visa Direct and UnionPay International Will Extend Global Money Movement Network to Billions of Cards in Chinese Mainland

headline: Macquarie Remains Bullish on Visa Inc. (V)
summary: Visa Inc. (NYSE:V) is one of the best long term low volatility stocks to invest in. On January 31, Macquarie reiterated a Buy rating on Visa Inc. (NYSE:V) and set a price target of $410.00. The rating update came after Visa Inc. (NYSE:V) reported its fiscal Q1 2026 earnings on January 29, reporting $10.9 billion […]
